title: Bharti Airtel share price falls marginally in today's session
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,851.90 on Tuesday, a decline of 0.30% from the previous close as of 1:00 pm. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. In terms of quarterly performance, Bharti Airtel's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 10.26 in June 2025, up from Rs 7.21 in June 2024. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26Analysing the yearly financials, the revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 33,778.30 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 5,848.60 Crore reported in March 2024. The company's EPS increased to Rs 58.00 in March 2025, up from Rs 13.09 in March 2024. Below is a summary of the consolidated yearly financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet ProfitRs -23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share, which is 320%, with the effective date being July 18, 2025. Further, the company had announced clarification on volume movement on August 11, 2025. The company’s financial ratios show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65. The debt-to-equity ratio was reported at 1.13 as of the year-ending March 2025. A Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 5, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,851.90, Bharti Airtel has shown a marginal decline of 0.30% in today's session.

title: ITC shares gain marginally in today's trading session
content: ITC shares were trading at Rs 417.25 on the NSE, a marginal rise of 0.10% from the previous close at 1:00 pm. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. Corporate Actions: ITC has announced several corporate actions, including media statements and investor presentations for Q1 FY 2025-26, and the scheme of amalgamation of Sresta Natural Bioproducts Private Limited and Wimco Limited with ITC Limited. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share (785%) on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. ITC has issued bonus shares on multiple occasions, including a 1:2 bonus ratio on July 1, 2016, and a 1:1 bonus ratio on August 3, 2010. The company underwent a stock split on September 21, 2005, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 1. With the stock currently trading at Rs 417.25, ITC has shown marginal positive movement in today's session, remaining a key component of the Nifty 50 index.

title: Maruti Suzuki, Tech Mahindra among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki and Tech Mahindra are among the top gainers on Nifty 50 at 1:03 pm on Tuesday. Maruti Suzuki is trading at Rs 12,874, a gain of 2.2 percent. Tech Mahindra is trading at Rs 1,511.90, up 2.08 percent from its previous close. M&M and Hero Motocorp are also among the top gainers on Nifty 50, gaining 1.89% and 1.85% respectively. Tata Steel is up 1.59%Maruti Suzuki Financial OverviewMaruti Suzuki's financial performance shows a steady increase in revenue over the past few years. The company has also demonstrated strong profitability and consistent earnings per share (EPS) growth. The consolidated quarterly financial results show consistent growth in revenue from ₹35,779.40 Crore in June 2024 to ₹38,605.20 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also increased from ₹3,702.10 Crore to ₹3,756.90 Crore during the same period. The EPS has also increased from ₹119.58 in June 2024 to ₹120.62 in June 2025. The consolidated yearly financial results show strong growth in revenue from ₹70,372.00 Crore in 2021 to ₹152,913.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also increased significantly from ₹4,220.10 Crore to ₹14,256.30 Crore during the same period. The EPS has increased from ₹145.30 in 2021 to ₹461.20 in 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 35,779.40 CroreRs 37,449.20 CroreRs 38,764.30 CroreRs 40,920.10 CroreRs 38,605.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,702.10 CroreRs 3,055.20 CroreRs 3,659.80 CroreRs 3,839.20 CroreRs 3,756.90 CroreEPS119.5898.68118.54124.40120.62Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 70,372.00 CroreRs 88,329.80 CroreRs 117,571.30 CroreRs 141,858.20 CroreRs 152,913.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,220.10 CroreRs 3,717.60 CroreRs 8,033.60 CroreRs 13,234.10 CroreRs 14,256.30 CroreEPS145.30128.43271.82429.01461.20BVPS1,738.431,832.242,046.072,723.793,061.07ROE8.367.0113.2815.7515.06Debt to Equity0.010.010.020.000.00The revenue for Maruti Suzuki increased by 7.79% from Rs 141,858.20 crore in 2024 to Rs 152,913.00 crore in 2025. Net profit also increased from Rs 13,234.10 crore in 2024 to Rs 14,256.30 crore in 2025, representing a 7.72% increase.Tech Mahindra Financial OverviewTech Mahindra's financial performance shows a mix of stability and growth in recent years. The consolidated quarterly financial results show stable revenue from ₹13,005.50 Crore in June 2024 to ₹13,351.20 Crore in June 2025. Net profit has increased from ₹862.20 Crore to ₹1,128.30 Crore during the same period. The EPS has increased from ₹9.62 in June 2024 to ₹12.87 in June 2025. The consolidated yearly financial results show growth in revenue from ₹37,855.10 Crore in 2021 to ₹52,988.30 Crore in 2025. Net profit has decreased and increased during this period, with a value of ₹4,351.80 crore in 2021 and ₹4,244.40 Crore in 2025. The effective date for this dividend is July 4, 2025. Hero Motocorp: The company announced its final dividend on May 13, 2025, offering Rs 65 per share. title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise 0.86% in Tuesday's session
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading higher at Rs 3,700.10 on Tuesday, marking a gain of 0.86% from the previous close. This increase reflects positive movement for the stock during the trading session. Financial Performance: Larsen & Toubro's financial performance shows consistent growth over the years. Here’s a summary of the company’s consolidated financial results: Revenue: The company's revenue has shown substantial growth over the past five years. The annual revenue increased from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,734.45 Crore in 2025. For the quarter ending June 2025, the company reported a revenue of Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. Net Profit: The net profit has also seen a significant rise. The annual net profit increased from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in June 2024. Earnings Per Share (EPS): The earnings per share have improved, with the annual EPS rising from Rs 82.49 in 2021 to Rs 109.36 in 2025. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 26.30, compared to Rs 20.26 in June 2024. title: Ajmera Realty Sets Record Date for ₹4.5/Share Final Dividend
content: Ajmera Realty & Infra India Ltd's board has greenlit a final dividend of ₹4.5 per equity share for the financial year 2024-25, pending shareholder approval. Investors should note the record date is set for September 2, 2025. The dividend payment, net of applicable taxes, is slated to occur on or before October 8, 2025, pending approval at the AGM. The dividend extends to all beneficial owners holding shares in dematerialized form, based on depository data as of close of business on September 2, 2025. It also covers members holding physical shares, contingent upon valid transmission or transposition requests lodged with the company by the same deadline. Details ₹4.5 September 2, 2025 On or before October 8, 2025 This information is for informational purposes and records.

title: Sebi buying the cool tool for faster investigations
content: Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) will be able to complete its investigations faster in future, as regulator is buying a tool that will analyse data in seized electronic devices quickly and prepare actionable intelligence for investigation. The regulator has short listed three firms based on technical parameters, including L&T Technology Services, Pelorus Technologies Pvt Lt and Starlight Data Solutions Pvt Ltd. As per the terms listed on government’s centralized purchase portal GEM, the tool including hardware and software-Digital Forensic - Mobile Devices Data Analysis is expected to do analysis of digital forensic data collected by Sebi from multiple digital forensic extraction, imaging of digital devices including mobile phone, laptop, iPad etc. and cloud data. It should also be able to ingest and integrate digital forensic data, create dashboards and analyse the data, facilitate collaborative workflows. The tender document suggests that, “The tool should simplify complex analysis, provide actionable intelligence, allow sharing data among multiple users for accelerated investigations, maintain forensic record and integrity of digital evidences." The tender document further said: “The solution should offer centralized data management capabilities to reduce risk and optimise storage needs. The solution should have advanced digital analysis capabilities in order to enable interactive search and filter options, different views of selected data, network visualization and in-depth event detail analysis”. The technical requirements listed include allowing uploading and analysis of at least 500 or more extractions at any point of time. Also, it should have the capacity to allow 20 or more users simultaneously. There should be no limitations on total size of data uploaded, stored and analysed by the solution during the contract period. It further said that there shall be no limitation on number of users created for access control and no limitation on number of cases created for access control. Sebi usually gathers a preliminary information against the manipulators based on its surveillance tools and then conducts search and seizures. In search and seizures, Sebi gathers evidence from the digital devices seized, to understand how manipulation plan was orchestrated, communicated and try to establish a link. Sebi then analyses the data, communication from such devices and makes a case against such entities after investigation. Sebi currently uses various such software to analyse bank accounts, email communication, chats etc from data dumps of devices. Sebi is now expecting that with new tool, it will be able to analyse data much faster and also give actionable intelligence. During searches Sebi teams comprises of forensic experts who quickly download data from digital devices and there after its returned to the owners of such devices. Then, it takes around months to analyse the data, connect the dots and make a case against persons and entities.
summary_lexrank: The tender document suggests that, “The tool should simplify complex analysis, provide actionable intelligence, allow sharing data among multiple users for accelerated investigations, maintain forensic record and integrity of digital evidences."
summary_luhn: It further said that there shall be no limitation on number of users created for access control and no limitation on number of cases created for access control.
summary_lsa: Sebi is now expecting that with new tool, it will be able to analyse data much faster and also give actionable intelligence.
summary_textrank: The regulator has short listed three firms based on technical parameters, including L&T Technology Services, Pelorus Technologies Pvt Lt and Starlight Data Solutions Pvt Ltd. As per the terms listed on government’s centralized purchase portal GEM, the tool including hardware and software-Digital Forensic - Mobile Devices Data Analysis is expected to do analysis of digital forensic data collected by Sebi from multiple digital forensic extraction, imaging of digital devices including mobile phone, laptop, iPad etc.

title: Yatra One extends rally for the second day on stellar Q1 results; stock up 40% in 2 days
content: Shares of Yatra One surged 16 percent to Rs 135 apiece on August 12, marking a second straight day of strong gains after the company posted a stellar June quarter (Q1FY26) performance. The rally comes on top of a 20 percent upper circuit hit yesterday, taking the two-day rise to over 40 percent. For the quarter ended June 2025, net profit jumped 298 percent year-on-year to Rs 16 crore, compared with Rs 4 crore in the same period last year. Revenue more than doubled, rising 108.1 percent to Rs 209.8 crore from Rs 100.8 crore a year earlier. Operating profit (EBITDA) surged 410.7 percent to Rs 22.98 crore from Rs 4.5 crore in Q1FY25, while the EBITDA margin improved sharply to 11 percent from 4.5 percent. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Gross bookings were up 9 percent year-on-year, supported by growth in the hotels and packages (H&P) segment, contributions from the meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions (MICE) business, the addition of 34 new corporate accounts, and a steep reduction in gross debt — from Rs 54.6 crore to Rs 2.9 crore sequentially. Gross margins for air travel improved to 4.6 percent from 3.1 percent a year ago, while gross margins for hotels rose to 9.05 percent from 7.46 percent. The strong quarterly performance was driven by a robust corporate travel business and higher-margin H&P operations, aided by continued momentum in MICE and standalone hotel cross-selling to existing customers. During the quarter, Yatra added 34 new corporate clients, with an annual billing potential of Rs 200 crore. The stock has rallied 53 percent in the past month. It touched a post-listing high of Rs 157.15 in September 2024 but still trades below its IPO price of Rs 142 per share. title: Accumulate Hindustan Petroleum Corporation; target of Rs 422: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Hindustan Petroleum Corporation (HPCL) reported refining throughput of 6.66mmt during the quarter with a reported GRM of USD3.08/bbl and implied gross marketing margin (GMM) of Rs7/lit (Rs3.0/lit in Q1FY25). Due to better GRM and GMM, standalone EBITDA grew 261% YoY to Rs76bn (Ple Rs89bn, BBGe Rs81bn) but came in lower-than-estimate due to poorer-than-estimated GRM (Ple USD6.2/bbl). We believe GRMs will rebound to the long-term average of USD5-7/bbl in FY26/27 and build in a GRM of USD6/7/bbl for FY26/27E. On the marketing front, we build in a GMM of Rs4.4/4.5/4.9/lit for FY25/26/27E. The company has reduced its debt from Rs633bn in FY25-end to Rs510bn in the quarter. Outlook The stock has corrected by ~10% in past few days. Due to possible strength in GMM in near term along with crude oil correction, we upgrade the stock to Accumulate with target price of Rs422 (earlier Rs360), valuing it at 1.3x FY27 PBV. title: Buy Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals; target of Rs 430: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals CROMPTON’s ECD segment gained market share in its core categories, despite overall industry decline. TPW fans, coolers, and agri and residential pumps reported a decline in sales, while solar pumps delivered 2x revenue growth and small domestic appliances registered double-digit growth. Lighting segment reported flat growth, despite industry slowdown, and its EBIT margin expanded by 380bps due to improved product mix and operational efficiencies. Butterfly business reported a moderate quarter, while the management has guided for double-digit growth in FY26. CROMPTON has amended its MoA to broaden its business activities, facilitating ECD expansion and entry into solar products. Solar products are gaining strong traction in its portfolio and are expected to deliver robust growth in FY26. Outlook We estimate revenue/EBITDA/ PAT CAGR of 11.4%/14.1%/19.0% over FY25-27E. We tweak FY26 earnings while maintaining FY27 estimates. We maintain ‘BUY’ rating with revised TP of Rs430 (Rs423 earlier), based on 35x FY27E earnings. title: Buy National Aluminium Co; target of Rs 228: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on National Aluminium Co National Aluminum (NACL) reported weak operating performance in Q1FY26 on low pricing and higher other expenses. Alumina/metal volumes grew 3x/6% YoY to 304kt/113kt on weak base. Average Q1 alumina NSR declined 37% QoQ to USD 419/t, while that for metal declined 6% YoY to USD 2,791/t. RM costs increased led by an inch up in caustic soda prices, while other expenses were elevated on account of RPO obligation compliance costs and higher repairs/ coal transportation costs, leading to below estimate EBITDA delivery. Mgmt. reiterated FY26 alumina sales guidance at ~1.28mt, supported by higher refinery output and increased export shipments. Ongoing 1mtpa refinery expansion is expected to commence operations by Jun’25 now and mgmt. is targeting incremental 0.5mt/1mt alumina in FY27/28E supported by Pottangi bauxite mine. Captive coal mines are ramping up well and expected to cater to ~56% of coal requirements at full capacity in FY26. NACL is also looking to expand its value-added business, which, along with other cost-saving initiatives, will support margins. However, being a pure play on alumina/metal pricing, earnings remain closely tied to price movements. Outlook We raise FY26/27E EBITDA by 4%/3% adjusting for higher alumina volume assumptions. Maintain ‘Buy’ with revised TP of Rs228 (from Rs218, assigning same 5x EV/EBITDA multiple). At CMP, the stock is trading at 5.4x/4.1x EV of FY26/27E EBITDA. title: Buy State Bank of India; target of Rs 960: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on State Bank of India SBI saw a decent quarter as core PPoP beat PLe by ~4%. NII/NIM was a miss due to lower NIM that was offset by better opex/fees. Asset quality remains strong as net slippages were 20bps lower at 49bps despite Q1 generally seeing more stress. Bank is not seeing delinquencies in SME/unsecured. Loan growth was a bit muted at 0.8% QoQ due to de-growth in corporate that was led by higher prepayments and intense competition. Xpress growth although slower, is guided to pick up. We are factoring a 12.5% CAGR in credit over FY25-27E. NIM would see further pressure in Q2FY26 but may bottom out and pick-up from Q3FY26. While most banks surprised negatively on core earnings for Q1FY26, SBI delivered superior results. Outlook Stock is trading at 1.0x on Mar’27 core ABV; we keep multiple at 1.3x and SOTP-based TP at Rs960. Retain ‘BUY’. title: United Breweries shares trade flat amid volume surge in today's session

title: Buy Fine Organic Industries; target of Rs 5610: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Fine Organic Industries Fine Organic (FINEORG IN) reported consolidated revenue of Rs5.88bn, up 7% YoY but down 3% QoQ. Export markets witnessed healthy demand growth during the quarter, while domestic demand remained stable. Raw material and freight prices also remained steady. All manufacturing facilities operated at full capacity, except for the Patalganga (food-grade) plant, which is expected to be fully utilized by the end of FY26. In Q4FY25, FINEORG incorporated a wholly owned subsidiary in the USA to set up a manufacturing facility and enhance supply chain efficiency, alongside acquiring ~159.9acres of land in Jul’25. The company also secured environmental clearance (a few other approvals expected shortly) for its Rs7.5bn greenfield project on SEZ land. Construction is scheduled to begin soon and is expected to take 18 months from commencement. We believe the new SEZ facility, and the planned US manufacturing plant will be key growth drivers. The SEZ plant is projected to deliver peak revenue potential of Rs26bn, based on an asset turnover of 3.5x, and is expected to contribute meaningfully to topline growth from FY28. Outlook At the current valuation, FINEORG trades at ~28x FY27E EPS. We maintain our ‘BUY’ rating with a revised target price of Rs5,610, valuing the stock at 33x FY27E EPS. title: Hold Navneet Education; target of Rs 136: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Navneet Education We cut our EPS estimates by 7%/8% for FY26E/FY27E as we fine tune our revenue growth assumptions for domestic stationary business amid weak performance in 1QFY26. While NELI IN’s operational performance was better than our estimates with EBITDA margin of 28.6% (PLe 27.2%); revenue was tad lower than our expectations as there was a delay in publication of grade-1 books in Maharashtra coupled with continued weakness in domestic stationary segment (realization/volume was lower by 9%/5% respectively). We expect revenue/EBITDA CAGR of 7%/8% over FY25-FY27E given rising competition in domestic stationary business and gradual migration of students from state board to CBSE oriented schools. Outlook NELI IN trades at inexpensive valuations of 16x/14x our FY26E/FY27E EPS estimates but given persistent growth challenges we maintain HOLD with a SoTP based TP of Rs136 (refer exhibit 5 for more details). title: Hold Voltas; target of Rs 1268: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Voltas We downward revise our FY26/FY27E earnings estimate by 18.5%/6.2% factoring in correction in aggregate volume in UCP while margins are expected to be at 5% due to promotional offers aimed at liquidating inventory, high fixed costs from low plant utilization, and increases in cost due to BEE norms. Anticipating strong demand, Voltas’s trade partners had built up inventory; however, softer secondary sales led to slower off-take and elevated stock levels, prompting the company to temporarily scale back production. UCP EBIT margins contracted due to focus on driving volumes through aggressive pricing and higher promotional spends along with low plant utilization. VOLT market share has declined in RAC segment (YTD market share of 17.8% as on Jun’25 vs 19.0% as on Mar’25). Company is optimistic in H2FY26 with festive-led demand and recovery expected, supported by inventory normalization and cost improvement initiatives across business verticals. Outlook Voltas Beko saw volume growth of 33% Q1FY26, led by better product mix and market share gains in refrigerators and washing machines. We estimate FY25-27E revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 9.0%/11.6%/14.6%. we revise SOTP-based TP to Rs1,268 (earlier Rs1,350), implying PE of 38x FY27E earnings. Maintain ‘HOLD’ rating For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. title: Hold Metro Brands; target of Rs 1135: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Metro Brands We cut FY26/FY27 EPS estimates by 1.9%/4.5% driven by 1) Higher store additions in a subdued demand environment, to likely increase overheads in the near term. We estimate margin contraction of 64bps/14bps in FY26/FY27 and 2) Weak store economics, driven by lower throughput/store amidst continued muted consumer sentiment. However, we believe operating parameters may improve in medium term only, led by 1) Stable store-level economics, aided by expansion into Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. 2) Normalization of BIS-related issues in near term and 3) Peaked-out losses in FILA, with an expected break even by FY27 and scale-up in Foot Locker from 2H26. Outlook We estimate 11.3% EPS CAGR over FY25-FY27, which gives us DCF based target price of Rs1135 (Rs1195 earlier). The stock currently trades at 68xFY27 EPS which limits near term upside in the stock. We retain HOLD. title: Hold Cummins India; target of Rs 3895: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Cummins India Cummins India (KKC) delivered a strong quarterly performance with revenue growing 26.2% YoY and EBITDA margin expanding by 117 bps YoY to 21.4%. Management guided for double-digit revenue growth in FY26 on the back of strong demand across segments. In Powergen, CPCB IV+ compliant products accounted for ~60% of domestic sales, with overall volumes reaching CPCB II levels and pricing stabilizing despite competitive pressure. Key end markets including infrastructure, airports, healthcare, and manufacturing continue to drive Powergen growth. The Industrial segment maintained steady momentum, supported by strong execution and growing aftermarket services across Railways, Construction, Mining, and Compressors. New product launches and deeper market penetration further bolstered the Distribution segment. On the export front, Latin America and Europe remained primary growth drivers, although management remains cautiously optimistic amid global uncertainties. We revise our FY26/27 EPS estimates by 3.3%/4.3% factoring in strong execution and demand in domestic and export markets. Outlook We downgrade our rating from ‘Buy’ to ‘Hold’ given a recent rally in stock and valuing a stock at a PE of 43x Mar’27E (42x Mar’27E earlier) with revised TP of Rs3,895 (Rs3,646 earlier). The stock is trading at a P/E of 48.5x/42.0x FY26/27E. title: Hold Century Plyboard; target of Rs 702: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Century Plyboard We downward revise Century Plyboard (CPBI) FY26E/FY27E earnings by 8.5%/9.3% due to major disappointment in the Particle Board segment in Q1FY26 and expectations of continued underperformance. CPBI has guided for revenue growth of 10%/20%/20%/40% in FY26 across its Plywood/Laminate/MDF/Particle Board segments with EBITDA margin expected at 12-14%/8-10%/15%/low single digits. We believe Plywood will continue to see healthy volume growth and better realizations as the company took a price hike of 2% in Q1FY26. Also the company highlighted during the call that Jul’25 saw the highest volume growth in its history, and improvement in Laminate and MDF segments. Outlook We expect overall revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 13.2%/26.1%/47.8% with Plywood/Laminate/MDF/Particleboard volume CAGR of 11.1%/14.0%/19.0%/15.6% over FY25-27E. We maintain our rating of ‘HOLD’ with TP of Rs702 (earlier Rs775), valuing at 35x FY27E. title: Hold Carborundum Universal; target of Rs 835: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Carborundum Universal We revise our FY26/27E EPS estimates by -16.3%/-5.4% accounting for continued weakness in Abrasives on account of Chinese dumping and nearterm headwinds in Rhodius. Carborundum Universal (CU) reported a modest 1.9% YoY increase in consolidated sales, while EBITDA margin contracted by 622 bps YoY to 9.9%, weighed down by weaker subsidiary profitability. In the Abrasives segment, logistics-related disruptions at Rhodius and softer demand across distribution channels due to inventory correction, impacted performance. Conversely, the Ceramics segment benefited from improved volumes and pricing in Industrial and Metallized ceramics. Standalone Electrominerals witnessed healthy demand from both domestic and export markets; however, consolidated profitability remained under pressure due to sanctions on VAW, leading to a ~25% volume decline. Given the prevailing near-term headwinds, management has downward revised its FY26 consolidated revenue growth guidance to 5.5–6.5% YoY. Outlook We maintain ‘Hold’ rating with a SoTP-based revised TP of Rs835 (Rs1,028 earlier) valuing Abrasives/Ceramics/Electrominerals at 30x/35x/15x Mar’27E (32x/40x/20x Mar’27E earlier). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Carborundum Universal - 11082025 - prabhu

title: Accumulate Kalpataru Projects International; target of Rs 1366: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Kalpataru Projects International Kalpataru Projects International (KPIL) reported revenue growth of 35.4% YoY driven by strong execution across T&D, B&F and O&G, while EBITDA margin remained flat YoY at 8.5%. The management has reiterated its guidance for 20–25% revenue growth in FY26, supported by a robust tendering pipeline of ~Rs1.2trn in the T&D segment over the next 12–18 months. The B&F segment continues to deliver strong performance, aided by significant order wins, despite persistent labor constraints. In the O&G segment, execution ramp-up of the large Saudi Aramco order is expected to act as a key growth catalyst. The Water segment, however, remains affected by collection delays. For FY26, the management anticipates total order intake of Rs260–280bn, ensuring healthy multi-year revenue visibility. Balance sheet strength is also expected to improve, driven by debt reduction and targeted reduction in NWC days to below 100. Outlook We revise our FY26/FY27E EPS estimates by +3.2%/+1.0% factoring in strong execution momentum in the T&D segment. We maintain ‘Accumulate’ rating with a revised SoTP-based TP of Rs1,366 (Rs1,268 earlier) valuing the core business at a PE of 18x on Mar’27E (17x Mar’27E earlier).For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Kalpataru Projects International - 11082025 - prabhu

title: Sensex, Nifty pare gains to trade flat as banks, FMCG and realty stocks fall
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex slipped into the red on Tuesday afternoon, August 12, erasing early gains as sharp losses in banking and FMCG stocks weighed on sentiment. Smallcaps bucked the trend to trade higher, while midcaps edged lower in line with the broader weakness. At about 12:20 pm, the Sensex was up 9.74 points or 0.01 percent at 80,613.82, and the Nifty was up 18.75 points or 0.08 percent at 24,603.80. About 2000 shares advanced, 1474 shares declined, and 144 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "Markets will be watching closely for the outcome of the Trump–Putin talks on August 7. A breakthrough that paves the way for ending the Russia–Ukraine war could dramatically lift sentiment, rendering the 25 percent penal tariff on India’s Russian oil imports irrelevant. However, given Trump’s unpredictable stance and his reported displeasure with India’s response, the outcome remains uncertain, says V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments Ltd said. "Meanwhile, the extension of China–US trade talks by another 90 days underscores Beijing’s negotiating leverage, particularly through its dominance in the rare earth magnet market. On the domestic front, robust equity inflows into mutual funds — Rs 42,702 crore in July — highlight retail investors’ optimism. This strong liquidity could continue to support the market even in the face of geopolitical challenges," he added. Also read: Axis AMC top boss on building transparency, trust after front-running crisis Sectoral indices were mixed in the afternoon, with Nifty Auto up 0.95 percent, Nifty Media rising 0.98 percent, and Nifty Metal gaining 0.84 percent among the top performers. Nifty IT, Nifty Oil & Gas, Nifty Pharma, Nifty Energy, and Nifty PSU Bank also traded higher. On the downside, Nifty Bank and Nifty Private Bank fell 0.45 percent each, while Nifty Realty slipped 0.69 percent, Nifty Consumer Durables dropped 0.40 percent, and Nifty FMCG eased 0.32 percent. The Nifty Midcap 100 was flat, and India VIX climbed 1.15 percent to 12.36, indicating a slight uptick in market volatility. Among movers, PG Electroplast shares gained 2 percent on Tuesday after a 36 percent plunge in the previous session, triggered by cuts to FY26 guidance and promoter selling. The company now projects 17–19 percent revenue growth, down from 30.3 percent, and has lowered its net profit target to Rs 300–310 crore from Rs 405 crore. Capex plans have also been trimmed to Rs 700–750 crore from Rs 800–900 crore. The correction drew some long-term investors looking to buy at lower valuations. Shares of National Securities Depository Ltd. (NSDL) swung sharply on Tuesday, August 12 — rising up to 5 percent in early trade before paring almost all gains — as investors awaited the depository’s first quarterly results since its market debut. At present, NSDL trades at a price-to-earnings multiple of about 79, compared to CDSL’s roughly 66. Hyundai Motor India Ltd gained as much as 3 percent after Goldman Sachs initiated coverage with a buy call, citing positive levelers for growth. The international brokerage has set a price target of Rs 2,600 per share, implying an upside potential of 21 percent from the last close on the NSE. Goldman Sachs said the company has strong positioning to outpace peers, particularly in FY27–FY28. Praj Industries shares declined nearly 9 percent to hit their two-year low after the company reported a 94 percent decline in consolidated profit after tax (PAT) to Rs 5.34 crore for Q1FY26 as against Rs 84.18 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations for the April–June quarter stood at Rs 640 crore, down from Rs 699 crore in Q1FY25. Read more: Thriving, not surviving: Meet India's apex MPV that is doing better than many SUVs Technical View "In the previous session, the Nifty opened flat but staged a strong recovery, rebounding over 230 points to close near the prior day’s high. This price action formed a bullish candlestick pattern, indicating sustained buying interest and upward momentum. Technically, a decisive move above 24,650 could open the door for an upside toward 24,850, while immediate support lies at 24,500 and 24,330 — both seen as attractive zones for fresh long positions," Amruta Shinde, Technical & Derivative Analyst at Choice Equity Broking, said. "The Bank Nifty also saw a sharp intraday reversal of nearly 580 points, forming a strong bullish candle that reflected continued buying at lower levels. It found firm support near the 20-week Exponential Moving Average (EMA), with key supports now placed at 55,320 and 55,000. Resistance is seen in the 55,700–56,000 range, and a convincing breakout above this zone could lead to a rally toward the psychological 56,200 mark," she added. Maruti Suzuki, Tech Mahindra, Hero MotoCorp, M&M, and Tata Steel were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Grasim, Eternal, Bajaj Finance, HUL, and ICICI Bank. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Avenue Supermarts shares rise 2.06% in Tuesday's session
content: Shares of Avenue Supermarts were trading higher in today's session, with the stock up 2.06% at Rs 4,270.70. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. The stock price movement was observed at 12:01 pm. Financial Highlights: Avenue Supermarts has demonstrated consistent financial performance. The consolidated annual revenue has increased steadily, from Rs 24,143.06 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 59,358.05 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also saw a rise, from Rs 1,099.43 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 2,707.45 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have grown from Rs 16.97 in 2021 to Rs 41.61 in 2025. The company's quarterly performance shows a similar upward trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,359.70 Crore, up from Rs 12,726.55 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2024. Net profit for the same period increased from Rs 563.14 Crore to Rs 772.81 Crore, and EPS rose from Rs 8.66 to Rs 11.88. title: Maruti Suzuki shares gain 2.68%; stock among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, rising 2.68% to Rs 12,934.00 in Tuesday's session. The stock's performance contributed to positive sentiment in the auto sector. Hero Motocorp, M&M, Tech Mahindra and Tata Steel were also among the top gainers on Nifty 50. Financial Snapshot: The consolidated annual financial data shows consistent growth. Revenue increased from Rs 70,372 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 152,913 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 4,220.10 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 14,256.30 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 145.30 in 2021 to Rs 461.20 in 2025. The debt to equity ratio remained stable at 0.00 during this period. The quarterly financial performance also reflects this growth trend. Revenue rose from Rs 35,779.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 38,605.20 Crore in June 2025. Net profit increased from Rs 3,702.10 Crore to Rs 3,756.90 Crore, and EPS increased from Rs 119.58 to Rs 120.62 over the same period. Annual Income Statement (Consolidated):HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 152,913 CroreRs 141,858 CroreRs 117,571 CroreRs 88,329 CroreRs 70,372 CroreOther IncomeRs 5,022 CroreRs 4,093 CroreRs 2,140 CroreRs 1,744 CroreRs 2,936 CroreTotal IncomeRs 157,935 CroreRs 145,951 CroreRs 119,712 CroreRs 90,074 CroreRs 73,308 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 138,364 CroreRs 128,587 CroreRs 109,379 CroreRs 85,412 CroreRs 68,054 CroreEBITRs 19,570 CroreRs 17,364 CroreRs 10,332 CroreRs 4,661 CroreRs 5,253 CroreInterestRs 194 CroreRs 193 CroreRs 187 CroreRs 126 CroreRs 101 CroreTaxRs 5,119 CroreRs 3,936 CroreRs 2,112 CroreRs 817 CroreRs 931 CroreNet ProfitRs 14,256 CroreRs 13,234 CroreRs 8,033 CroreRs 3,717 CroreRs 4,220 CroreThe sales increased by approximately 7.79% from Rs 141,858 crore in Mar 2024 to Rs 152,913 crore in Mar 2025. The net profit increased by approximately 7.72% from Rs 13,234 crore in Mar 2024 to Rs 14,256 crore in Mar 2025. Quarterly Income Statement (Consolidated):HeadingJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 38,605 CroreRs 40,920 CroreRs 38,764 CroreRs 37,449 CroreRs 35,779 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,888 CroreRs 1,511 CroreRs 1,057 CroreRs 1,523 CroreRs 1,060 CroreTotal IncomeRs 40,493 CroreRs 42,431 CroreRs 39,822 CroreRs 38,972 CroreRs 36,839 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 35,538 CroreRs 37,537 CroreRs 35,116 CroreRs 33,836 CroreRs 32,004 CroreEBITRs 4,954 CroreRs 4,893 CroreRs 4,705 CroreRs 5,136 CroreRs 4,835 CroreInterestRs 46 CroreRs 47 CroreRs 46 CroreRs 43 CroreRs 57 CroreTaxRs 1,151 CroreRs 1,006 CroreRs 999 CroreRs 2,038 CroreRs 1,076 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,756 CroreRs 3,839 CroreRs 3,659 CroreRs 3,055 CroreRs 3,702 CroreCash Flow: The cash flow statement indicates that cash flow from operating activities was Rs 16,136 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 16,801 Crore in March 2024. Investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of Rs 14,456 Crore in March 2025, and financing activities showed an outflow of Rs 4,155 Crore. Balance Sheet: The balance sheet shows that the company's share capital has remained relatively stable, with slight increases over the years. Reserves and surplus have grown significantly, from Rs 52,349 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 96,082 Crore in March 2025. Total liabilities have also increased, from Rs 71,282 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 131,971 Crore in March 2025. Key Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Maruti Suzuki show a basic EPS of Rs 461.20 and diluted EPS of Rs 461.20 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 3,061.07. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: The company announced a final dividend of Rs 135 per share on April 25, 2025, which was paid on August 1, 2025. The company also had a rights issue with existing ratio of 1 and offered ratio of 2 which was announced on 1993-09-30. Maruti Suzuki celebrated 10 Years of NEXA and unveiled Grand Vitara PHANTOM BLAQ Edition recently. Also, there was a newspaper advertisement for Notice of hearing of the petition in relation to the scheme of amalgamation of Suzuki Motor Gujarat Private Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary (Transferor Company), into and with Maruti Suzuki India Limited (Transferee Company). With the stock trading among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, Maruti Suzuki reflects strong investor confidence and positive market momentum.
summary_lexrank: Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 145.30 in 2021 to Rs 461.20 in 2025.

title: Reduce Equitas Small Finance Bank; target of Rs 55: Emkay Global Financial
content: Emkay Global Financial' research report on Equitas Small Finance Bank Equitas continued to post dismal results, as it slipped into loss of Rs2.2bn, mainly due to persistent higher MFI/non-MFI stress and accelerated standard provisions on MFI loans (Rs1.9bn, mainly to ease provisioning in 9MFY26). Overall gross slippages were higher at Rs6.6bn/8.3% of loans, mainly due to the impact of adverse ordinances in the states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu impacting collections in MFI and even spilling over into the SBL portfolio (below Rs0.7mn). However, the bank resorted to higher write-offs to keep GNPA ratio below 3% (at 2.9%), to qualify for a Universal Bank license. The management guides for mid-teen credit growth in FY26, and expects MFI stress to ease by 4Q. This, coupled with utilization of standard provisions, should help the bank remain profitable for the full FY26E. Outlook Factoring in the sharp cut in earnings and continued stress, we retain REDUCE with an 8% cut in TP to Rs55, valuing the bank at 1x Jun-27E ABV. The bank plans to raise Tier I (equity capital) of Rs12.5bn to shore up its capital buffer (Tier I at 17.2%). title: Buy State Bank of India; target of Rs 975: Emkay Global Financial
content: Emkay Global Financial' research report on State Bank of India SBI posted a ~6% beat on PAT at Rs192bn/1.1% RoA, led by higher other income (especially treasury gains) and controlled opex, partially offset by higher provisions. Credit growth remained well above the system’s at ~12% YoY, led by healthy growth in the retail and MSME segments, while corporate growth moderated due to higher pre-payments (Rs120bn). The management believes that the healthy pipeline on project financing, coupled with expected acceleration in mortgages in 2H, should support overall credit growth at ~12% with upward bias in FY26E. Margins could correct a bit in 2Q albeit improve in 2H, benefiting from the CRR/deposit rate cut and the recent capital raising with exit NIM at 3%. Outlook We largely retain FY26-28E earnings and expect the bank to deliver a healthy RoA of ~1.0-1.1%/RoE of ~15-17%. We maintain BUY with TP at Rs975 (valuing the SA bank at 1.2x Jun-27E ABV/subs at Rs270/sh). title: Buy Can Fin Homes; target of Rs 900: Geojit Financial Services
content: Geojit Financial Services research report on Can Fin Homes Can Fin Homes Ltd. (CANF) is the housing finance arm of Canara Bank. Predominantly active in South India, the company offers a wide range of financial products, including housing loans, composite loans, non-housing loans, mortgage loans, and commercial property loans, in addition to fixed and cumulative deposits. The loan book grew by 9.0% YoY to Rs. 38,773 cr. The client base now stands at 2.83 lakh. Net interest income grew by 12.9% YoY to Rs. 349 cr. The net interest margin (NIM) edged moderately lower to 3.6% compared to last quarter. The cost-to-income ratio in Q1FY26 inched up mainly due to a one-time actuarial impact from salary revisions and increased rent from new branches and zonal offices. It is expected to normalize to around 18% in FY26 and 19% in FY27 with IT costs factored in. PAT grew modestly by 12.1% YoY to Rs. 224 cr in Q1FY26, despite an uptick in provisions. The increase in provisioning was a deliberate and tactical move by the management, aimed at cleaning up sticky accounts early in the fiscal year. Asset quality experienced slight deterioration, with GNPA/NNPA rising to 0.98%/0.54% from 0.91%/0.49% in Q1FY25. The Provision Coverage Ratio (PCR) also declined to 45.2% from 46.5% in Q1FY25. Outlook As the benefit of the rate cut is transmitted only after it has been experienced by the bank, the NIM is expected to remain stable. The bank has guided for a credit cost of 15 bps for FY26, anticipating that asset quality will remain within a stable range. ROA and ROE are projected to remain largely stable at 2.1% and 16.6%, respectively, over FY26– 27. Therefore, we assign a BUY rating with a revised target price of Rs. 900, based on 1.8x FY27E BVPS. title: Buy Voltas; target of Rs 1568: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Voltas Hit by an erratic summer, Voltas’ UCP fell 25% y/y in Q1, its market share down to 17.8% (June-end 19.3%). Under-absorption and higher promotions squeezed margins, while inventory was high. Voltas Beko gained share but is still in investment mode, while Projects posted a stronger order book. Outlook Management expects Q2 weakness but sees recovery from Q3, with a longterm focus on market leadership, selective growth, and innovation. We retain a Buy, with a 12-mth TP of Rs1,568 (earlier Rs1,544). title: Ipca Laboratories Shareholders Approve Director Re-appointments at AGM
content: Ipca Laboratories (IPCALAB) held its 75th Annual General Meeting on August 11, 2025, approving key resolutions, the company announced. Shareholders voted on director re-appointments and amendments to the Memorandum and Articles of Association at the virtual meeting. Key Approvals: Adoption of Audited Financial Statements: Approved with near unanimous support. Declaration of Dividend: Approved, confirming dividend payment on equity shares. Re-appointment of Mr. Prashant Godha: Approved with a significant majority. Re-appointment of Mr. Premchand Godha: Approved with a substantial majority. Appointment of Secretarial Auditors: Approved the appointment of M/s. Parikh & Associates. Ratification of Remuneration to Cost Auditors: Approved the remuneration to M/s. ABK & Associates. Alteration to the Memorandum of Association: Approved the alteration to the object clause. Alteration to the Articles of Association: Approved the alteration to the interpretation clause. title: Hindustan Unilever share price falls 0.57% in Tuesday's trading session
content: Hindustan Unilever shares experienced a decline of 0.57% in Tuesday's trading session, with the stock price at Rs 2,504.10. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 2,536.60, a 1.28 percent change from its day's high price and a day's low of Rs 2,503.50, a 0.02 percent change from its day's low price at 11:40 am. title: Bajaj Finance shares fall 1.72% in Tuesday's trading session
content: Shares of Bajaj Finance declined by 1.72% to Rs 862.70 in Tuesday's trading session. Earlier in the session, the stock touched a day's high of Rs 884.90 and a low of Rs 855.95. The stock is currently trading on the Nifty 50. On the corporate front, Moody's Ratings, in a press release dated August 4, 2025, assigned Bajaj Finance a new rating of Baa3 Corporate Family Rating (CFR) with a Stable outlook. The company announced a bonus issue on April 29, 2025, with an existing ratio of 1:4, and the ex-bonus date was June 16, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on April 29, 2025, with the old face value of Rs 2 being split into a new face value of Rs 1. The ex-split date was June 16, 2025. Regarding dividends, Bajaj Finance announced a final dividend of Rs 44 per share (2200%) on April 30, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. A special dividend of Rs 12 per share (600%) was announced on April 29, 2025, effective May 9, 2025. title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat after decline of 0.39% in last 1 hour
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,687.40, a rise of 0.52% in Tuesday's session. According to recent alerts, the stock experienced a decline of 0.39% in the last 1 hour, with the previous hour's price at Rs 3,701.70 as of 11:50 am. Financial Snapshot: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company’s EPS for June 2025 was Rs 26.30, compared to Rs 20.26 in June 2024. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, compared to Rs 15,569.72 Crore in March 2024. The company's EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 109.36, up from Rs 93.96 in March 2024. title: Infosys share price dips marginally after change in last 1 hour
content: Shares of Infosys were trading at Rs 1,429.30, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.08% in Tuesday's session. Earlier in the day, the stock saw some volatility after change in last 1 hour, with its price fluctuating. In terms of quarterly financial performance, Infosys reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 42,279 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, compared to Rs 40,925 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025, Rs 41,764 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, Rs 40,986 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024, and Rs 39,315 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 6,924 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 7,038 Crore reported for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS stood at Rs 16.70 for the quarter-ending June 2025. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance of Infosys:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70Analysing the yearly financial performance, Infosys reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 162,990 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 153,670 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 26,750 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 26,248 Crore reported for the year-ending March 2024. The EPS stood at Rs 64.50 for the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the yearly financial performance of Infosys:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual income statement shows that sales increased from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 162,990 Crore in March 2025. The net profit also increased from Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 26,750 Crore in March 2025. Infosys announced a final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share (440%) with effective date of 30 May, 2025. title: Ipca Laboratories shares rise 2.01% in Tuesday's trading session
content: At 11:39 AM on Tuesday, Ipca Laboratories shares were trading at Rs 1,363.60, a gain of 2.01% in today's session. The stock is trading positively on the NSE. Financial Overview Ipca Laboratories' consolidated financial performance showcases consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased steadily from Rs 5,419.99 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,939.59 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 1,148.84 Crore in 2021 to Rs 787.53 Crore in 2025. The following table presents the key financial figures for Ipca Laboratories over the past five years:YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20215,419.991,148.8445.01371.7924.240.0520225,829.79910.9534.85219.5116.090.1420236,244.32491.9318.58233.168.060.2520247,705.04529.2125.82304.578.640.2220258,939.59787.5335.14273.8810.610.19The revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased by 15.9% compared to the year ending March 2024. Similarly, the net profit increased by 48.8% during the same period. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 25.82 in 2024 to Rs 35.14 in 2025. Quarterly Performance The consolidated quarterly revenue for Ipca Laboratories has also shown a positive trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,308.85 Crore, up from Rs 2,092.63 Crore in June 2024.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20242,092.63198.987.58Sep 20242,354.90245.449.05Dec 20242,245.37277.339.78Mar 20252,246.6965.782.67Jun 20252,308.85234.429.19The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 234.42 Crore, compared to Rs 198.98 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS increased from Rs 7.58 in June 2024 to Rs 9.19 in June 2025. The company’s sales for the year ending March 2025 were Rs 8,939 Crore, compared to Rs 7,705 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s other income for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 92 Crore, compared to Rs 124 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s total income for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 9,032 Crore, compared to Rs 7,829 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s total expenditure for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 7,816 Crore, compared to Rs 6,848 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s EBIT for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,216 Crore, compared to Rs 980 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s interest for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 84 Crore, compared to Rs 138 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s tax for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 343 Crore, compared to Rs 313 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Balance Sheet The total liabilities of the company as of March 2025 are Rs 11,760 Crore compared to Rs 11,101 Crore in March 2024. The total assets of the company as of March 2025 are Rs 11,760 Crore compared to Rs 11,101 Crore in March 2024. Cash Flow Net cash flow as of March 2025 is Rs 168 Crore compared to -Rs 823 Crore in March 2024. Key Ratios The basic EPS as of March 2025 is Rs 35.14 compared to Rs 25.82 in March 2024. The P/E ratio as of March 2025 is 42.74 compared to 47.92 in March 2024. The debt to equity ratio as of March 2025 is 0.19 compared to 0.22 in March 2024. Corporate Actions Ipca Laboratories has announced several corporate actions, including shareholder meetings and financial results announcements. The company declared a final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) on May 29, 2025. A bonus issue of 1:1 was announced on October 27, 2004, with an ex-bonus date of January 28, 2005. Additionally, the company has undergone stock splits, including one on January 10, 2022, where the face value changed from Rs 2 to Rs 1, and another on March 22, 2010, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Ipca Laboratories is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Moneycontrol analysis as of August 5, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. Ipca Laboratories' stock is currently trading positively, with the company demonstrating consistent financial growth and having announced several corporate actions.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall marginally; over 2.6 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,511.40 on the NSE. At 11:20 am, the stock showed a marginal decline of 0.28% from its previous close, with a traded volume of over 2.6 lakh shares. Financial Overview: The following tables provide a concise look at the financial performance of Hindustan Unilever. Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514.00 Crore, compared to Rs 15,670.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 2,769.00 Crore, up from Rs 2,476.00 Crore in the previous quarter. Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased to Rs 63,121.00 Crore from Rs 61,896.00 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an increase, reaching Rs 10,679.00 Crore for the year ending March 2025 compared to Rs 10,286.00 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Audio Video Recording of Earnings Call held on 31st July, 2025 has been released. Schedule of Analyst/Investor Meet has been announced. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share were announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. Hindustan Unilever had last announced a bonus issue on September 30, 1991, with a bonus ratio of 1:2 and an ex-bonus date of July 19, 1991. The company's stock split occurred on July 3, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Moneycontrol analysis, dated August 8, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,511.40, Hindustan Unilever has seen a marginal decline of 0.28% from its previous close.

title: ITC shares gain marginally in today's session; over 48.4 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 417.65 on the NSE, a marginal gain of 0.19% from the previous close at 11:20 am. Over 48.4 lakh shares were traded in today's session. title: Bharti Airtel shares trade marginally down in today's session; over 13.8 lakh shares traded
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading at Rs 1,854.30 on the NSE at 11:20 am, a marginal decline of 0.17% from the previous close. Over 13.8 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. In terms of quarterly results, the consolidated revenue for Bharti Airtel for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 10.26 in June 2025, compared to Rs 7.21 in June 2024. title: Petronet LNG shares rise 2.09% in Tuesday's trading session
content: Shares of Petronet LNG were trading higher in Tuesday's session, with the stock price increasing by 2.09% to Rs 278.80. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Overview: Petronet LNG's financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Performance: Key quarterly figures include:Revenue: The company’s revenue has seen fluctuations over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 11,879.86 Crore, compared to Rs 13,415.13 Crore in June 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 824.44 Crore, a decrease from Rs 1,100.76 Crore in June 2024.EPS: Earnings per share stood at Rs 5.61 for the quarter-ending June 2025, down from Rs 7.37 in June 2024.Annual Performance: The annual financial performance shows these trends:Revenue: The company’s revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 50,982.03 Crore, slightly lower than Rs 52,729.33 Crore in March 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,883.92 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 3,527.02 Crore in March 2024.EPS: The earnings per share increased from Rs 24.35 in March 2024 to Rs 26.48 in March 2025.BVPS: The Book Value Per Share increased from Rs 116.07 in March 2024 to Rs 132.52 in March 2025.ROE: Return on Equity decreased from 20.97% in March 2024 to 19.98% in March 2025.Debt to Equity: The debt-to-equity ratio remained stable at 0.00 in March 2025.The following tables provide a more detailed look at Petronet LNG's financial performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 13,415.13 CroreRs 13,024.29 CroreRs 12,226.86 CroreRs 12,315.75 CroreRs 11,879.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,100.76 CroreRs 848.99 CroreRs 866.59 CroreRs 1,067.58 CroreRs 824.44 CroreEPS7.375.806.017.305.61Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 26,022.90 CroreRs 43,168.57 CroreRs 59,899.35 CroreRs 52,729.33 CroreRs 50,982.03 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,920.30 CroreRs 3,339.46 CroreRs 3,187.80 CroreRs 3,527.02 CroreRs 3,883.92 CroreEPS19.5922.9222.1724.3526.48BVPS78.7191.12101.76116.07132.52ROE24.8925.1521.7820.9719.98Debt to Equity0.010.000.000.000.00The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 50,982.03 Crore compared to Rs 52,729.33 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,883.92 Crore compared to Rs 3,527.02 Crore in March 2024. EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was 26.48 compared to 24.35 in March 2024. Corporate Actions: Petronet LNG has been actively communicating with its shareholders and the investor community. Key announcements include:Analyst/Institutional Investor Meet: On August 4, 2025, the company announced the schedule of an analyst meet.Earnings Call Transcript: Also on August 4, 2025, the transcript of the post-result concall held on July 28, 2025, was released.TDS on Final Dividend: On July 30, 2025, an intimation was made regarding the deduction of Tax at Source (TDS) on the final dividend for the financial year 2024-25.In terms of dividends, the company announced a final dividend of Rs 3 per share (30%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Based on Moneycontrol analysis as of today, the sentiment for Petronet LNG is very bearish. Petronet LNG shares were trading higher in Tuesday's session, with the stock price increasing by 2.09% to Rs 278.80.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 0.68% in today's session; over 10 lakh shares traded
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading with a gain of 0.68% at Rs 3693.40 in Tuesday's session. Over 10 lakh shares were traded as of about 11.20 am. Financial Highlights Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 26.30 in June 2025 from Rs 20.26 in June 2024. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 55,119.82 CroreRs 61,554.58 CroreRs 64,667.78 CroreRs 74,392.28 CroreRs 63,678.92 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,440.11 CroreRs 4,112.81 CroreRs 4,001.03 CroreRs 6,133.44 CroreRs 4,325.57 CroreEPS20.2624.6924.4339.9826.30Consolidated Yearly Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 255,734.45 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 15,569.72 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 109.36 in March 2025 from Rs 93.96 in March 2024. Key financial ratios include a book value per share (BVPS) of Rs 710.12 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.33 for the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 135,979.03 CroreRs 156,521.23 CroreRs 183,340.70 CroreRs 221,112.91 CroreRs 255,734.45 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,668.96 CroreRs 10,291.05 CroreRs 12,624.87 CroreRs 15,569.72 CroreRs 17,687.39 CroreEPS82.4961.7174.5193.96109.36BVPS625.97678.79736.87746.01710.12ROE15.2610.5211.7215.1215.39Debt to Equity1.731.501.331.321.33The annual income statement shows consistent growth. Sales have steadily increased from Rs 135,979 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 255,734 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, net profit has risen from Rs 4,668 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 17,687 Crore in March 2025. Corporate Actions Larsen & Toubro announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share (1700%) with an effective date of June 3, 2025. Other recent corporate actions include:August 11, 2025: L&T secured a contract from Adani Power for 6,400MW Thermal Power for CarbonLite Solutions Business.August 6, 2025: Clarification on news item appearing in Media / Publication.The company has also announced several bonus issues in the past, with the most recent being on May 29, 2017, with a bonus ratio of 1:2 and an ex-bonus date of July 13, 2017. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3693.40, Larsen & Toubro shows positive momentum in today's session, supported by strong financial performance and strategic contract wins.

title: Adani Total Gas shares rise 2.01% in Tuesday's trading session
content: Shares of Adani Total Gas were trading higher at Rs 608.30 in Tuesday's session as of 11.26 am, a gain of 2.01% from the previous close. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Overview: Adani Total Gas's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,999.86 Crore, up from Rs 4,474.74 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 639.38 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 649.60 Crore recorded in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5.95, compared to Rs 6.07 in March 2024. The company’s consolidated quarterly revenue also reflects this upward trajectory. In the quarter ending June 2025, the revenue was Rs 1,378.58 Crore, an increase from Rs 1,341.26 Crore in the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 161.03 Crore, up from Rs 148.40 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 1.50, compared to Rs 1.41 in the quarter ending March 2025. Expenditure also increased, totaling Rs 4,070 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 3,528 Crore in the previous year. EBIT was reported at Rs 960 Crore, compared to Rs 989 Crore in the corresponding period. Interest paid amounted to Rs 100 Crore, down from Rs 111 Crore. The net profit was Rs 639 Crore, while it was Rs 649 Crore in the previous year. title: SJVN, Biocon stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 11:30 am on Tuesday, SJVN and Biocon stocks were among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. SJVN's shares rose 5.17 percent, while Biocon's shares gained 3.48 percent. Other notable gainers included Hitachi Energy, Jindal Stainless, and Petronet LNG. SJVN Financial Highlights: SJVN's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 917.45 Crore, compared to Rs 504.40 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 870.37 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 236.89 Crore, compared to a net loss of Rs 130.36 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and a net profit of Rs 356.19 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.58, compared to Rs -0.32 for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 0.91 for the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 2,485.39 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,072.01 Crore in 2025. The net profit decreased from Rs 1,641.78 Crore in 2021 to Rs 812.32 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the EPS decreased from Rs 4.19 in 2021 to Rs 2.08 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 32.55 in 2021 to Rs 36.08 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) decreased from 12.86 percent in 2021 to 5.78 percent in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.15 in 2021 to 1.90 in 2025. Biocon Financial Highlights: Biocon's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,941.90 Crore, compared to Rs 4,417.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 3,432.90 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 89.20 Crore, compared to Rs 459.40 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 861.80 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.26, compared to Rs 2.88 for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 5.51 for the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 7,105.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 15,261.70 Crore in 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 925.40 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,429.40 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 6.24 in 2021 to Rs 8.46 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 70.09 in 2021 to Rs 180.27 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) decreased from 9.83 percent in 2021 to 4.68 percent in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.47 in 2021 to 0.82 in 2025. Hitachi Energy Financial Highlights: Hitachi Energy's standalone yearly revenue increased from Rs 3,420 Crore in December 2020 to Rs 6,384 Crore in March 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 99 Crore in December 2020 to Rs 383 Crore in March 2025. Jindal Stainless Financial Highlights: Jindal Stainless' consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 12,188.46 Crore in 2021 to Rs 39,312.21 Crore in 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 414.25 Crore in 2021 to Rs 2,543.42 Crore in 2025. Petronet LNG Financial Highlights: Petronet LNG's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 26,022.90 Crore in 2021 to Rs 50,982.03 Crore in 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 2,920.30 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,883.92 Crore in 2025. Corporate Actions SJVN announced Interim dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-02-13, effective date as 21 Feb, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.1.15. Also, announce date as 2024-05-29, effective date as 12 Sep, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.0.65. Biocon announced Final dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-05-08, effective date as 04 Jul, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.0.50. Also, announce date as 2024-05-16, effective date as 05 Jul, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.0.50. Hitachi Energy announced Final dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-05-14, effective date as 13 Aug, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.6.00. Also, announce date as 2024-05-21, effective date as 14 Aug, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.4.00. Jindal Stainles announced Interim dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-01-29, effective date as 07 Feb, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.1.00. Also, announce date as 2024-05-15, effective date as 30 Aug, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.2.00. Petronet LNG announced Final dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-05-19, effective date as 04 Jul, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.3.00. Also, announce date as 2024-10-24, effective date as 08 Nov, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.7.00. Petronet LNG also had bonus issue on 09 May, 2017 in the ratio of 1:1.

title: NSDL shares edge higher ahead of first Q1 results since market debut
content: Shares of National Securities Depository Ltd. (NSDL) swung sharply on Tuesday, August 12 — rising up to 5 percent in early trade before paring almost all gains — as investors awaited the depository’s first quarterly results since its market debut, amid a broader decline in Indian equities. The stock had a volatile start to the week. On Monday, it briefly touched an intraday high of Rs 1,425, nearly 80 percent above its IPO price of Rs 800, before giving up gains and ending the session over 12 percent lower from the day’s peak. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Rival Central Depository Services (India) Ltd. (CDSL) recently reported a 15.3 percent sequential rise in revenue and an improvement in margins for the June quarter. However, the number of new demat accounts opened during the period dropped 11 percent both sequentially and year-on-year, even as demat custody value grew compared to the previous quarter. Since listing, NSDL shares have rallied sharply, pushing valuations above those of CDSL — a reversal from the discount they traded at prior to debut. The company entered the market on August 6 at Rs 880 on the BSE, a 10 percent premium to its issue price. The debut premium was lower than grey market expectations, though analysts have largely maintained a long-term bullish view on the stock, citing NSDL’s dominant position in the depository business. Also read: We've strengthened the team and have a more diversified portfolio, says Axis AMC's B Gopkumar At present, NSDL trades at a price-to-earnings multiple of about 79, compared to CDSL’s roughly 66. By around 11 am, NSDL shares were trading at Rs 1,290 on the NSE, up 1.4 percent from the previous close, with about 1 crore shares changing hands — sharply lower than the 5 crore shares traded yesterday. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

(NSDL) swung sharply on Tuesday, August 12 — rising up to 5 percent in early trade before paring almost all gains — as investors awaited the depository’s first quarterly results since its market debut, amid a broader decline in Indian equities.
summary_luhn: By around 11 am, NSDL shares were trading at Rs 1,290 on the NSE, up 1.4 percent from the previous close, with about 1 crore shares changing hands — sharply lower than the 5 crore shares traded yesterday.

title: SJVN shares surge 5% on steady Q1 revenue, strong margins
content: Shares of SJVN climbed 5 percent to Rs 98 apiece on August 12 after the state-run hydropower producer reported stable sales and operational results for the June quarter (Q1FY26). So far in 2025, the stock has declined 12 percent, underperforming the benchmark Nifty 50’s 2 percent rise over the same period. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog For the quarter ended June 2025, SJVN’s consolidated net profit fell 36.2 percent year-on-year to Rs 227.8 crore. This decline came despite growth in revenue and an improvement in profit margins. Revenue from operations increased 5.4 percent to Rs 917.5 crore from Rs 870.4 crore in the same period last year, while operating profit (EBITDA) rose 11.2 percent to Rs 742.4 crore. Operating margin improved to 80.9 percent from 76.7 percent in Q1FY25, supported by higher efficiency in the generation business. The renewable energy segment, which includes wind and solar power, contributed Rs 115.62 crore to revenue in Q1FY26, more than doubling from Rs 55.83 crore a year earlier. Revenue from power trading, however, fell to Rs 0.78 crore from Rs 1.94 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Other income during the quarter dropped to Rs 54.14 crore from Rs 88.10 crore in the year-ago period, with the bulk coming from bank interest and late payment surcharges from beneficiaries. On the policy side, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has directed public sector power companies — including SJVN, NTPC, NHPC, and Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) — to amend their renewable energy tenders to mandate the use of Indian-made solar cells. These PSUs also act as renewable energy implementing agencies (REIAs) as part of India’s plan to achieve 500 GW of non-fossil fuel power capacity by 2030. According to a senior MNRE official, the requirement will take effect 30 days after the ministry publishes “List II” of approved modules and manufacturers, specifically for solar cells. The list is expected next month, meaning tenders floated from October onward will be required to use Indian-made solar cells. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Revenue from operations increased 5.4 percent to Rs 917.5 crore from Rs 870.4 crore in the same period last year, while operating profit (EBITDA) rose 11.2 percent to Rs 742.4 crore.
summary_luhn: On the policy side, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has directed public sector power companies — including SJVN, NTPC, NHPC, and Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) — to amend their renewable energy tenders to mandate the use of Indian-made solar cells.
summary_lsa: The list is expected next month, meaning tenders floated from October onward will be required to use Indian-made solar cells.

Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 303.28 Crore, while it was Rs 313.80 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. title: Hindustan Unilever shares gain 0.59% in morning trade
content: Hindustan Unilever shares were trading higher at Rs 2,533.20 on the NSE, up 0.59% in Tuesday's session. This increase reflects a gain of Rs 14.80 compared to its previous close, with the stock showing positive movement in morning trade. Financial Performance: Hindustan Unilever's financial performance shows steady growth over the past few years.
